==Japanese==
<div style="float:right;">
{{wikipedia|lang=ja}}
{{wikipedia|Mandarin duck}}
[[File:Pair_of_mandarin_ducks.jpg|thumb|250px|{{lang|ja|鴛鴦}} (''oshi'', ''oshidori'', ''en'ō''): a pair of '''[[mandarin duck]]s'''.]]
</div>

===Etymology 1===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=おし}}
From {{m|ja|愛し|tr=oshi||{{l|en|dear}}, {{l|en|loving}}}}, from the way the ducks are believed to mate for life and seldom stray far from one another.

The spelling is from {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=おし}}, with {{m|ja|鴛}} representing the male bird and {{m|ja|鴦}} representing the female bird.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=irr|おし|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おし|hhira=をし}}

# a {{l|en|mandarin duck}}, ''[[Aix galericulata]]''
# a kind of {{m|ja|家紋|tr=kamon||family crest}} featuring a mandarin duck

===Etymology 2===
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=irr|sort=おしどり|r=y}}

Originally a compound of {{compound|ja|愛し|tr1=oshi|t1={{l|en|loving}}|鳥|tr2=tori|t2={{l|en|bird}}|sort=おしどり}}, from the way the ducks are believed to mate for life and seldom stray far from one another.  {{rendaku2|sort=おしどり|tori|dori}}

The spelling is from {{etyl|zh|ja|sort=おしどり}}, with {{m|ja|鴛}} representing the male bird and {{m|ja|鴦}} representing the female bird.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=k|おしどり|acc=2|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5,NHK}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|おしどり|オシドリ|hhira=をしどり}}

# a {{l|en|mandarin duck}}, ''[[Aix galericulata]]''
# {{lb|ja|sort=おしどり|metaphor}} a {{l|en|pair}} of {{l|en|lovebird}}s: a {{l|en|loving}} {{l|en|couple}}
# a {{l|en|topknot}} or {{l|en|bun}} {{l|en|hairstyle}} wherein the hair is bunched on each side in a shape vaguely resembling two mandarin ducks

=====Derived terms=====
* {{ja-r|鴛鴦夫%婦|おしどり ふう%ふ}}: a {{l|en|loving}} {{l|en|couple}}

=====Usage notes=====
{{U:ja:biology|オシドリ}}

[[Category:ja:Ducks|おしどり]]

===Etymology 3===
{{ja-kanjitab|えん|おう|yomi=o}}

{{IPAchar|/weɴau/}} → {{IPAchar|/weɴɔː/}} → {{IPAchar|/eɴoː/}}

From {{der|ja|ltc|sort=えんおう|鴛鴦|tr={{IPAchar|/ʔuən ʔɑŋ/}}|lit=male mandarin duck” + “female mandarin duck}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|yomi=kanon|えんおう|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,SMK5}}

====Noun====
{{ja-noun|えんおう|hhira=ゑんあう}}

# a {{l|en|mandarin duck}}, ''[[Aix galericulata]]''
# {{lb|ja|sort=えんおう|metaphor}} a {{l|en|pair}} of {{l|en|lovebird}}s: a {{l|en|loving}} {{l|en|couple}}

=====Usage notes=====
The ''en'ō'' reading appears to be less common than ''oshidori'' above.
